student_data.notes: Undergraduate count derived from Daily Northwestern reporting 'over 1,400 students' because CS is split between McCormick School of Engineering and Weinberg College of Arts & Sciences. Official McCormick facts only list the engineering portion (668). Graduate (MS) and PhD counts taken directly from McCormick facts page as CS graduate degrees are primarily housed there. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

gpu_resources.notes:
Calculated from Quest Documentation System Configuration: 
1) General Access A100: 25 nodes x 4 GPUs = 100 A100 (80GB). 
2) Genomics Cluster A100: 2 nodes x 4 GPUs = 8 A100 (80GB). 
Total A100 = 108. 

3) General Access V100: 12 nodes x 2 GPUs = 24 V100 (32GB). 
4) General Access V100 (older): 2 nodes x 4 GPUs = 8 V100 (16GB). 
Total V100 = 32. 

Documentation mentions K80 nodes are retired. No explicit H100 general access nodes listed in public system configuration as of May 2024. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: Northwestern CS students are split between two colleges (McCormick and Weinberg), making single-source verification tricky; the student newspaper provides the aggregate total. GPU resources are centralized under 'Quest'. The 108 A100 count is verifiable via the NUIT Research Computing GitHub documentation.
